required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Pemetrexed and Carboplatin Compared With Etoposide Carboplatin to Treat Extensive-Stage Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Phase 3 Trial of Alimta (Pemetrexed) and Carboplatin Versus Etoposide and Carboplatin in Extensive-Stage Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a Phase 3, global, multi-center, open-label study of patients with extensive-stage small cell lung cancer. Eligible patients will be randomly assigned to receive either pemetrexed plus carboplatin or etoposide plus carboplatin. It is anticipated that pemetrexed plus carboplatin will offer similar survival benefits as compared to etoposide plus carboplatin.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 19.6 months)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 19.6 months)
baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 14.7 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Each Cycle in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Lung (FACT-L)
Overall Survival (Subgroups: LDH<=Upper Limit of Normal and History of Brain Metastases=Yes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death due to any cause (up to 19.6 months)

intervention.description: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles
Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of extensive stage small cell lung cancer (SCLC)
- Capable of self-care but may be unable to carry out any work activities.
- No prior anticancer therapy for SCLC
Exclusion Criteria:
- have previously participated in a study involving pemetrexed
- have received treatment within the last 30 days with a drug that has not received regulatory approval for any indication

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who received at least one dose of study drug were, per protocol, the patient population used for the summary of safety data (eg, Serious Adverse Events).

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

milestone.title: Received at Least One Dose of Study Drug

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

class.title: 3 - Partially Confined to Bed, Limited Self Care

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 19.6 months)
outcome.population: Number of participants with events. In the pemetrexed+carboplatin group, 242 participants were censored. In the etoposide+carboplatin group, 288 participants were censored.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.
measure.population: Number of participants with events. In the pemetrexed+carboplatin group, 242 participants were censored. In the etoposide+carboplatin group, 288 participants were censored.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (Subgroups)
outcome.description: The effects of individual baseline factors (sex, race, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance, region, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), age, number of metastatic sites, and history of brain metastases) on overall survival are reported. For two subgroups - LDH<=upper limit of normal and brain metastases=yes, the upper limits of the 95% confidence interval were not calculable for the etoposide+carboplatin group - instead the number of participants in these two subgroups are presented as a post-hoc outcome measure.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 19.6 months)

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

measure.title: Overall Survival (Subgroups)
measure.description: The effects of individual baseline factors (sex, race, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance, region, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), age, number of metastatic sites, and history of brain metastases) on overall survival are reported. For two subgroups - LDH<=upper limit of normal and brain metastases=yes, the upper limits of the 95% confidence interval were not calculable for the etoposide+carboplatin group - instead the number of participants in these two subgroups are presented as a post-hoc outcome measure.

class.title: History of Brain Metastases: No (n=410, n=412)

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value for ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) Performance Status: 0 or 1.
P-value for ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) Performance Status: 2.
P-value for LDH (lactate dehydrogenase): >Upper Limit of Normal.
P-value for History of Brain Metastases: No.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival
outcome.description: The period from study entry until disease progression, death or date of last contact.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 14.7 months)
outcome.population: All randomized participants. Number of participants censored: 113 in Pemetrexed+Carboplatin; 150 in Etoposide+Carboplatin.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

measure.title: Progression Free Survival
measure.description: The period from study entry until disease progression, death or date of last contact.
measure.population: All randomized participants. Number of participants censored: 113 in Pemetrexed+Carboplatin; 150 in Etoposide+Carboplatin.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Each Cycle in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy – Lung (FACT-L)
outcome.description: FACT-L measures following domains of health-related quality of life (HR-QL): physical well-being, social/family well-being, emotional well-being, functional well-being, and additional concerns of lung cancer. Total scores range from 0 to 136, with higher scores representing better HR-QL. A clinically meaningful change is considered to be 5 points.
outcome.population: Number of randomized participants with baseline and non-missing value at respective cycle.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Each Cycle in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy – Lung (FACT-L)
measure.description: FACT-L measures following domains of health-related quality of life (HR-QL): physical well-being, social/family well-being, emotional well-being, functional well-being, and additional concerns of lung cancer. Total scores range from 0 to 136, with higher scores representing better HR-QL. A clinically meaningful change is considered to be 5 points.
measure.population: Number of randomized participants with baseline and non-missing value at respective cycle.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (Subgroups: LDH<=Upper Limit of Normal and History of Brain Metastases=Yes)
outcome.description: The effects of individual baseline factors (lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) and history of brain metastases) on overall survival are reported. The Upper Limits of the 95% Confidence Intervals were not calculable for these factors in the Etoposide+Carboplatin group. The number of participants in these subgroup are instead presented as a Post-Hoc Outcome Measure.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death due to any cause (up to 19.6 months)
outcome.population: The upper limit of the 95% Confidence Intervals (CI) were not calculable for these two subgroups in the etoposide+carboplatin group so medians and lower limits of the 95% CI are not presented. A post-hoc outcome measure table provides the number of participants in each subgroup.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

measure.title: Overall Survival (Subgroups: LDH<=Upper Limit of Normal and History of Brain Metastases=Yes)
measure.description: The effects of individual baseline factors (lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) and history of brain metastases) on overall survival are reported. The Upper Limits of the 95% Confidence Intervals were not calculable for these factors in the Etoposide+Carboplatin group. The number of participants in these subgroup are instead presented as a Post-Hoc Outcome Measure.
measure.population: The upper limit of the 95% Confidence Intervals (CI) were not calculable for these two subgroups in the etoposide+carboplatin group so medians and lower limits of the 95% CI are not presented. A post-hoc outcome measure table provides the number of participants in each subgroup.

outcome.title: Number of Participants in Subgroups: LDH<=Upper Limit of Normal and History of Brain Metastases=Yes
outcome.description: Number of participants with Low Density Lipoprotein <=upper limit of normal and the number of participants with a history of brain metastases. This post-hoc outcome replaces the one for Overall Survival (Subgroups: LDH<=Upper Limit of Normal and History of Brain Metastases=Yes).
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death due to any cause (up to 19.6 months)

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

measure.title: Number of Participants in Subgroups: LDH<=Upper Limit of Normal and History of Brain Metastases=Yes
measure.description: Number of participants with Low Density Lipoprotein <=upper limit of normal and the number of participants with a history of brain metastases. This post-hoc outcome replaces the one for Overall Survival (Subgroups: LDH<=Upper Limit of Normal and History of Brain Metastases=Yes).

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles (Participants who received at least one dose of study drug)

group.title: Etoposide + Carboplatin
group.description: Etoposide: 100 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), days 1-3 x 6 cycles Carboplatin: Area under the curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles. (Participants who received at least one dose of study drug)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
